summary: This bill proposes to award a Congressional Gold Medal to James J. Andrews and William H. Campbell, the only civilian members of Andrews' Raiders, for their bravery during the Civil War's Great Locomotive Chase. It outlines the medal's design, presentation, and placement at the Smithsonian Institution.  It also authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to create and sell bronze duplicates of the medal, with proceeds going to the US Mint Public Enterprise Fund.  The bill specifies the medals are national medals and numismatic items.
